intro: Vincetoxicum alpicola, commonly known as the alpine bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces pale green to yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Vincetoxicum alpicola is adapted to grow in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its resilience in harsh environments.
